contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|cap}} {{TOC right}} '''Cap''' may refer to: ==Lids, covers, closures== * [[Cap]], a form of headgear * [[Lid (container)]] ** [[Bottle cap]], a closure to seal bottles ** [[Screw cap]], a closure to seal bottles or jars * [[Pipe cap]], a pipe fitting used to seal the end of a pipe * [[Camper shell]], raised, rigid covering for the rear bed of a pickup truck ==Finance== * [[Interest rate cap]] * [[Non-economic damages caps]] * [[Tax cap]] * [[Salary cap]] * [[Market capitalization|Market cap]], a truncation of market capitalization ==People== * [[Captain America]], the character's nickname * [[Caspar Weinberger]], his nickname * [[Vladislao Cap]], an Argentine footballer * [[Carlos Andrés Pérez]], a Venezuelan president * [[Cap Anson]], 19th century baseball player ==Science, mathematics and technology== * [[Pileus (mycology)]], the cap of a mushroom or related fungi * [[Polar ice cap]] * [[Caprock]], a layer of erosion-resistant rock overlying weaker rock * [[Capping inversion]], inhibits atmospheric convection * [[Bandwidth cap]], on a computer network * [[Capacitor]], a type of electronic component * [[Spherical cap]], portion of a sphere cut off by a plane * [[Blasting cap]], an explosive detonator * [[Screenshot]], a computer screen image capture * [[Capricornus (constellation)]], astronomical constellation abbreviation "Cap", as standardized by the International Astronomical Union ===Medicine and biology=== * [[Knee cap]] * [[Crown (dentistry)]], a tooth cap * [[Community-acquired pneumonia]] * [[Cervical cap]], contraceptive device * [[Therapy cap]], on per person Medicare spending * [[5' cap]], part of an mRNA ==Other== * [[Cap (sport)]], a statistic representing an athlete's appearance in a select team game * [[Percussion cap]], a small amount of percussion-sensitive explosive, held in a tape or small cup * [[wikt:Cap.|Cap.]], an abbreviation of the Latin word for 'chapter', used for parts of a legislative act or statute; e.g. Cap. 19(1)(7) is Chapter 19, section 1, sub-section 7. * [[Cap and Gown Club]], an eating club at Princeton University * [[Cap and trade]], in global warming ==See also== * [[CAP (disambiguation)]] * [[Capping (disambiguation)]] * [[Caps (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
